name: NPR
text:
The Salehs are among the thousands of Syrian refugees who make up about 70% of Jordan's farmworkers. They were working when a fire broke out in their tent — killing their 4 youngest kids. 

"We aren't the first people or the last people to suffer this." https://t.co/j2gkk7DRZD

name: NPR
text:
Review: Suzanne Park's debut adult novel is a crackling romance starring a young woman trying to make it in the extremely male-dominated gaming industry — can she find love AND a career? 

Signs point to yes. https://t.co/FfpL4ZfDB4

name: NPR
text:
If you choose to engage in racial equity dialogue: reflect, be intentional, and be informed, says the director of the American Negotiation Institute. 

This helps you to understand the impact of your action or inaction. 
https://t.co/V6Rrln6tlR
